results.title: FATF Code of Conduct
results.description:
The FATF is committed to fostering a respectful, inclusive and safe working environment for its members, stakeholders and staff and ensuring the organisation’s work is carried out with integrity and professionalism. 
The purpose of this Code of Conduct is to communicate what kind of conduct is expected from participants in FATF meetings and work projects.

results.title: Webinar: Complex Proliferation Financing and Sanctions Evasion Schemes
Webinar: Comprehensive Update on Terrorist Financing Risks
Sint Maarten's measures to combat money laundering and terrorist financing
results.description: The Caribbean Financial Action Task Force (CFATF) assessment of Sint Maarten's  measures to combat money laundering and terrorist financing.

results.title: Jamaica and Nigeria to join FATF Guest Initiative
results.description: Jamaica and Nigeria are the two new countries invited by the FATF President to participate in the FATF-Style Regional Body (FSRB) jurisdictions Guest Initiative aimed at fostering inclusiveness, enhancing the cohesion of the Global Network and strengthening global capacity in the fight against illicit finance.

results.title: Consolidated assessment ratings
results.description: An up-to-date overview of the ratings on both effectiveness and technical compliance for all countries assessed against the 2012 FATF Recommendations and using the 2013 Assessment Methodology.

results.title: Curaçao's measures to combat money laundering and terrorist financing
results.description: The Caribbean Financial Action Task Force (CFATF) assessment of Curaçao's  measures to combat money laundering and terrorist financing.

results.title: FATF to host webinars on Terrorist Financing Risks and Proliferation Financing and Sanctions Evasion Schemes
results.description: The FATF will hold two webinars this month to help strengthen global understanding across the public and private sectors of risks and vulnerabilities connected to terrorist financing and proliferation financing, aiming to improve responses to these evolving threats.

results.title: FATF Launches New Procedure to Address Unintended Consequences Affecting Non-Profit Organisations
results.description: The FATF has introduced a new process to address unintended consequences arising from the implementation of its Standards on non-profit organisations (NPOs), strengthening global efforts to protect legitimate NPO activity from disproportionate disruption.

results.title: Consolidated Processes and Procedures for Mutual Evaluations and Follow-Up Universal Procedures
results.description: The set of core elements that apply to all anti-money laundering and counter-terrorist financing assessments, in accordance with the FATF 2013 Methodology. These procedures were last revised in June 2025.
